comments.body:
It's making the site borderline unusable. Just typing out any item name makes "similar" posts show up that aren't even related to mine.

The whole "similar idea" rule isn't good either. Someone else could have the same idea, but it's completely underdeveloped, unbalanced, too complicated, etc.

And let's be honest, no one is going to read the comments, especially when there are hundreds. The oldest comments get priority over all others, which also is a problem.

This also effects the amount of votes that idea gets.

this would probably explain why half my posts are gone.

the other half is because i keep making 1984 refrences.

never forget the glorious days before update 1.19.84.
Si yo disfrutaba mucho ver Minecraft modo historia y creo que s√≠ deber√≠a volver
Duplicate posts are considered spam, which is annoying. Feedback posts are supposed to offer unique ideas.
Duplicate posts usually add some ideas the original didn't have so they should at least be put somewhere in the general discussion around one idea
^Then they're similar idea posts. Better than duplicates, at least.
The new ideas could be added as comments

This problem has worsened exponentially since the recent copper bulb debacle. You can't find any constructive or useful posts anymore, they're all just repeating the same sentiment to revert the bulb, adding nothing new to the discussion. I considered making a post suggesting a completely different behavior for the copper bulb, but I knew it would just get buried. How is anybody going to find good feedback under all the spam and garbage?
My account is bug
IT'S so stupid like I was going to report about cloud saves failed to be used when i got a new hard drive but I CAN'T
This is really needed.
There should be other sign-in options, in fact, there should be the migration from Jira to Microsoft Accounts.
If you cannot create an account on the bug tracker, my best advice is to try again at a later date.

Please know that although Mojang uses the bug tracker, Minecraft Support is unable to fix any issue that arises from the bug tracking website, since JIRA is actually owned by Atlassian, not Mojang nor Microsoft.
The migration of Jira to Microsoft Accounts has to start.
The Bug tracker website has to change to bugs.minecraft.net.
That's super cool!!! They also need to add an achievement category
There should also be a terrain features and decorators category.

I've read the rules about pending approval messages on this site, but I feel the site needs a new, better way to judge pending approvals. I posted a post about ocean ruin looks and loot updating, but it's pending approval. After searching 'ocean ruin' on this site, I saw no posts saying anything remotely close to my idea, but since there are many posts with the word 'ocean', there is a chance the site thinks that has repeated in my post. Nothing inappropriate in the post. I posted a post with a similar idea as this comment, and now even that is "pending approval" ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

(talking to the person above, can't @ them because this site just censors everyone's usernames. All I can see is "Registered User")

"Pending Approval" is something ALL posts have to do. It has nothing to do with whether or not you included the word 'ocean.' It doesn't mean you did anything wrong.

The fact that there are as many repeat suggestions and troll posts as there are on this site should be an obvious indicator that posts aren't that difficult to get approved. You just have to wait, it doesn't take that long.

(and yeah, I'm aware this comment was made 3 years ago).

I understand you on how annoying it is. Literal keyboard smash spam is allowed to be posted everyday, but when I make detailed posts with concept art(s) it doesn't get approved, neither as a comment to a similar idea nor as an individual post. The moderation on this site is terrible, so annoying :/
Maybe a minimum of 1000 posts are needed before your post will simply never get pending approval anymore, unless you delete one of your already published posts.
This would be great. It would also help the posts with titles that dont pop out, but have awesome information inside so they can get the votes they deserve.
How about instead each person could give each idea more than one vote?

@Willian Miller Thanks for your comment!

While that would also allow priority to influence a post, there would have to be something to stop people from voting an arbitrarily large number of times. One such way is a a finite "vote budget" that each user can spend on the things they want more, but I can't imagine a simple way to do it so it would be useful, and wouldn't cause inflation when we transfer over - which would devalue all existing posts. Also, there would still only be the one way to measure popularity of a post. Looking at vote count alone, you woud not be able to distinguish between many people thinking something is a good idea, versus only one person or a few people wanting something really really badly.

I wouid want to stick with vote count measuring the number of bodies, and to include priority as a separate value.

What I meant was that the voters could give between one and five votes, or something like that.  There should also be a separate number that shows how many people voted (or the average number of votes per person).
Agreed!

this has nothing to do about this and i agree with you but i really think i need stuff to get to the minecraft people very badly because i think it could help them a whole lot :

please dont use your filter thingy to auto delete any more posts or at least make it less strict and if im not putting this in the right spot its because i couldnt find it and the help section isnt helping !

I bet you minecraft people could have a way way better game if you just dont delete awesome ideas randomly !

some ideas might be similar or have similar names but its not actually a "duplicate"!

:(

if you delete this than ill just try to get into every other area of this site that i can type a word into

dont delete this dont delete this

also i need help getting back all of my old and super awesome ideas :( :(
While on Notes, you can revise any saved posts.
i just had it happen to one of mine i noticed i misspelt the word custom and they deleted it why i must ask if i just fixed a spelling error

I literally just saw a post with swear words in. I can‚Äôt believe it was approved unlike some of my ideas that I take a lot of time in making. Something needs to be done because people like me who are careful with responses and take time in making them only for them to be removed are the people that are losing out. Seriously, please improve this website
Remember to check for spelling mistakes while your post is pending approval.

The Castle Ruins post has been approved (it is now under the name Village and Castle Ruins). I do hope that this problem does not happen again. If it is happening to you then please vote for this suggestion so that the developers of this website can fix this problem once and for all
wait spelling mistakes cause this? that's not right imo.
I know this post is hard to understand but I have to go through great measures to byp-ass the c-nsorship
There are also checks on profanity. If a post contains any profanity word from the Bedrock profanity filter, the post is removed.

There should be a minimum character count for a post, and maybe a filter to see the most up-voted comments which should reduce the number of repeated comments. Given post max out at 1,000 comments it can be frustrating to run across an older poster and not add something new but see dozens of the same comment across the sub-pages (usually "Good Idea"). Which honestly is the point of the vote button...comments should be critics and constructive feedback on the post.

[Multiple] Tags on Posts, Filtering Option for Reading Ideas, and Notification System for Changelogs

For reference to show that no quotes were robbed of context or with the intent of harm to moderation
This is so tough I totally agree why is this site not better supported for a game so quick to brag about the power of community they do not do this site justice it is super depressing.
Cars pls?
It would be nice if it was extended a bit more.
Maybe up to 3000 characters, 5000, 10000, 15000, 20000 or even 100000 characters?

Finally I found another user with the same problem I've got. My old mailadress no longer exists, since I can't provice the Transaction ID from 2010 or sometime around that and now I am not able to migrate my account. I got pointed in the feedback section, so hopefully a solution for this problem may be found!

Has nobody addressed this?? Literally bought minecraft twice because it wouldn‚Äôt transfer to the Xbox one from the 360, plus all the storey modes again, and again for the iPad! Have a bjillion mods and add ons for it over the last 10 years for my daughter and they want me to find a code from the very first one??!?!
I don‚Äôt think so Tim.
and maybe a category for new advancements
How about they just integrate it into Minecraft itself, at least on consoles.
Yes please there are so many plant ideas spread into different categories
I only see a use for this for console players because you can literally change your skin in game. Most people who play on a console usually don't have a PC, but it is a good concept.
This would be great help for this issue
If that player is playing, they can be reported for a bad username.
maybe one for posts too?
Isn't that just Reporting?
yes. but, there is no reporting category for mean comment or post.

It's weird, because I always thought that comments were moderated.  They always say "appending approval," so I assumed they were being checked by someone.  It's really weird that some comments manage to get through even when they can be really rude.
You can report the comments with the option that says "violates posting guidelines". It includes those comments
sometimes when I comment it doesn't say pending approval, it just automatically lets it through. idk why though.
Maybe there should be a profanity filter, taken from Bedrock Edition.
Some comments are spam comments and even reporting them does not seem to make them go away most of the time.

I agree. Animals clunk up the category a lot.

Remember to vote on your own post too.
Guess what? It did get added as a category! :)

While we do have this idea:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011134192-RSS

What you're describing here is a bit more complex and will require investigation with our web team for push notifications, which must be controllable by you of course! We would never want to push notifications on a community member without them opting in for this info first.

Generally the notification system for the software powering the website operates via email notifications, and the subscribe button, which is much more likely to be implemented first.

Not saying no, just saying it will definitely need to go under more discussion and investigation with the team for feasibility here. Thanks for the suggestion!
Console devices should also be selectable.
